title: Does Paul McCartney know what ‘McLennon’ is? - Quora

response.answer_text: More likely than not I would say yes. I can’t imagine it’s possible for him not to know about it as there are many fans who believe in it. Although he is pretty old and so probably doesn’t roam around social media to really see the extent of it. I’m sure there were people back in the 60s who believed in McLennon (although maybe they didn’t have the name. I’m not sure when ship names became a thing) but for sure there were people who thought John and Paul were together on some level. I’ve heard that people went around Apple calling Paul “Johns Princess” (although I don’t know if that’s necessarily true) and they did have a very close relationship so I’m sure there are early Beatles fans who liked the idea of them together. Whether or not Paul has seen the art and the various fanfiction, I don’t know. I can’t imagine it’s something he really talks about much as he probably doesn’t want to fuel people’s fantasies if they’re not true. I personally don’t believe McLennon was a thing but don’t have a problem with people who like it. They’re cute together, I can understand the appeal of it. I don’t think it’s as problematic as other ships that aren’t real because John is dead so no one is harassing Paul about needing to confess his love for him so they can be together. Shipping can be quite problematic, but I do it a lot too and as long as you realize what’s appropriate and what’s not I think it’s a healthy way of understanding and appreciating relationships.

Yes. When the documentary about their touring years was being prepared, he suggested the director to visit you tube and look for the videos showing him and John. He was afraid the documentary would show them the way some people think: not being close friends. It doesn’t mean he agrees with the McLennon theory, but it means he knows the meaning as he knows the videos. As the pictures used are true, ( though it doesn mean the theory is true) he thought it would be important to see how close they were. He also sent a note once to a page dedicated to some fan fictions about McLennon saying it was okay to keep on writing them but they had to let clear they were fiction. If it is clear enough they could go on writhing those beautiful stories. He indeed said they were beautiful. Only too strict people are mad about those stories. Paul doesn’t mind.
